1. Start the game – the Ubisoft autopatch will update it automatically, and you should let it do it

(C:Program Files (x86)UbisoftUbisoft Game Launcher) for x64 based systems
(C:Program FilesUbisoftUbisoft Game Launcher) for X86 Based Systems

6. Make a password 6-8 characters long. Check Remember Me
*Make sure the Force Offline mode is checked – Hit Apply*

For those having MOUSE PROBLEMS, this is due to other gamepads or controller such as the Razer NOSTROMO being installed.  Even if the gamepad is NOT plugged in, you may still have the issue of not being able to look around with the mouse, but mouse in menus work fine.

My problem was having the NOSTROMO installed on win7 x64.  TO FIX:


1. Go to START MENU-CONTROL PANELS-DEVICE MANAGER



2. Click on HUMAN INTERFACE DEVICES



3.  Look for RAZER NOSTROMO or any other gamepad driver, [Right Click], and DISABLE.



4.  Start GRFS

Menus should now show PC keyboard buttons instead of Xbox controller buttons.



At least for the RAZER NOSTROMO, it is not necessary to re-enable the driver in device manager while playing.  I've been able to run the NOSTROMO CONFIGURATOR and play other games using the Razer Nostromo without having to re-enable the driver.



Hope this helps anyone with the mouse problem.
